intro: Oscularia guthrieae, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a fine layer of white, waxy hair, which helps reduce water loss. Oscularia guthrieae produces small, bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths.
